Debrief.synopsis: In the aftermath of the battle in the colony, Jaheira reflects on next steps and officially asks to join our party.
Debrief.how_to_trigger: Debug Book -> Set quest flags -> Act 2 -> SCE - Epilogue -> Set up good path -> Go off-path -> Block Florrick -> Start the debrief.

AD_EpilogueIntro.synopsis: Jaheira AD's on returning back from the confrontation with Ketheric (If there). To draw attention to the player and encourage them to speak with her. Also going to use this to address that the player could do with recruiting her again if they did before.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: From the provided information, there are two sessions: 'Debrief' and 'AD_EpilogueIntro'. The 'Debrief' session occurs in the aftermath of a major battle when Jaheira reflects on what comes next and decides to join the party—triggered by a series of flags including Act 2 and the epilogue setup. In contrast, 'AD_EpilogueIntro' is presented as the dialogue when Jaheira returns after the confrontation with Ketheric. Its purpose is to catch the player’s attention and hint that if Jaheira had already been recruited previously, she could be re-recruited. This suggests that the two sessions represent alternate narrative paths. In one narrative branch, the player sees 'Debrief' (implying a fresh recruitment process), while in the other, the player encounters 'AD_EpilogueIntro' (implying a situation where she was previously recruited and is now returning). Therefore, these sessions do not occur sequentially—they are mutually exclusive narrative outcomes rather than parts of a strict linear order.

Debrief_12.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_12.text: If you have business to conclude before we march, have it done.

Debrief_20.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_20.text: The road to Baldur's Gate is long.

Debrief_51.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_51.text: Our enemies spread like rub-rot - treat one patch, and two more bloom in its place.

Debrief_27.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_27.text: An elder brain, bound by lost Netherese magic, with servants of the Dead Three holding the chain.
Debrief_27.context: NodeContext: Casually ticking off world-ending threats on her fingers

Debrief_1.speaker: Player
Debrief_1.text: You almost seem like you're enjoying yourself.

Debrief_13.speaker: Player
Debrief_13.text: I'm having the time of my life.

Debrief_40.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_40.text: It is good to savour the moment of victory - but pace yourself. Our fight is just beginning.

Debrief_63.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_63.text: When we met, I was licking my wounds - an old bear with her leg caught in the hunter's snare.

Debrief_16.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_16.text: Now, I've slipped free of the trap and rediscovered my claws.

Debrief_41.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_41.text: It's time for me to hunt my prey.

Debrief_32.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_32.text: You have a Netherstone, and you're on the scent of two more.

Debrief_26.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_26.text: These Chosen have reason to fear you - and I would like to be at your side when you confront them.

Debrief_0.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_0.text: The city needs me - the Harpers know their tasks.

Debrief_57.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_57.text: And I know my calling. I thought my grand adventures were behind me, but I should have known better.

Debrief_30.speaker: Player
Debrief_30.text: Of course. I already told you - you're welcome in my party.

Debrief_21.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_21.text: Falling foul of Ketheric convinced me that my grand adventures were behind me - that even if I survived, I should hang up my blades.

Debrief_8.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_8.text: We ventured into darkness together - now we've come out the other side, I'd say I'm feeling a little refreshed.

Debrief_48.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_48.text: When we reach Baldur's Gate, there will be even darker paths to tread. I will follow you wherever they lead.

Debrief_18.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_18.text: You're amply reinforced already. I'll let the new blood do all the running around, for now.

Debrief_62.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_62.context: NodeContext: Wry, little mock bow - not intended as sarcastic, just a callback to how she would take orders in previous games.

Debrief_9.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_9.text: How does it compare to a shadow-cursed inn?

Debrief_52.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_52.text: With the Absolute's army gone, the Risen Road should be clear - we can follow it all the way to Baldur's Gate.

Debrief_61.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_61.text: There's a Harper safe-house in Wyrm's Crossing - Danthelon's Dancing Axe. We'd do well to check in with them before entering the city proper.

Debrief_38.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_38.text: Beyond that, our course is yours to set. Find me at your camp. I can remember how to take orders, as well as give them.

Debrief_10.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_10.text: Beyond that, our course is yours to set. I can recall how to take orders, as well as give them.

Debrief_50.speaker: Player
Debrief_50.text: On second thought - no, Jaheira. Best we part ways.

Debrief_53.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_53.text: Your way is my way, just as your fight is my fight. But suit yourself.

Debrief_7.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_7.text: One awkward evening in camp, until we are free of this place. And then you will be free of me.

Debrief_59.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_59.text: You ventured into the heart of darkness when I could not.

Debrief_22.speaker: Player
Debrief_22.text: I'll be glad to have you by my side.

Debrief_11.speaker: Player
Debrief_11.text: I don't think so, Jaheira. Go your own way.

Debrief_4.speaker: Player
Debrief_4.text: I've got a parasite in my brain - makes it hard to enjoy anything.

Debrief_28.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_28.text: You came here in search of a cure, but found a conspiracy instead - I can see how that would be disheartening.

Debrief_56.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_56.text: But take courage - we have killed a man who could not die, and stripped the Absolute's army of its general.

Debrief_34.speaker: Player
Debrief_34.text: You've tangled with the Dead Three before?

Debrief_2.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_2.text: Extensively. Mind flayers too - but I never dreamed of seeing gods and illithids working in consort.

Debrief_14.speaker: Player
Debrief_14.text: Spent a lot of time in mind flayer colonies, have you?

Debrief_36.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief_36.text: More than anyone should. But I never dreamed I'd see the Dead Three working in consort with illithids.

AD_EpilogueIntro_0.speaker: Jaheira
AD_EpilogueIntro_0.text: I've been thinking on all that you learned below. If you've caught your breath, we ought to discuss our next steps.

AD_EpilogueIntro_1.speaker: Jaheira
AD_EpilogueIntro_1.text: I've been thinking on all that we learned below. If you've caught your breath, we ought to discuss our next steps.
